xxl.core.util.random

Class RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.util.random.RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContinuousRandomWrapper

    public class RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG
extends Object
implements ContinuousRandomWrapper
    The class provides a random number generator delivering random numbers distributed like a user-defined function F.
    If f(x) is the pdf of the distribution F, a function g(x) with f(x) <= c * g(x) for some constant c must be given with g(x) the pdf of a distribution G. Random numbers with distribution F could be obtained by the following algorithm: (1) Generrate a random number x with distribution G
    (2) calculate r = c * g(x) / f(x)
    (3) Generrate an unifomly distribution random number u ( ~ U[0,1])
    (4) IF u*r < 1 return x, otherwise start again
    To obtain random numbers x with x ~ G the InversionDistributionBasedPRNG could be used.
    For producing random numbers use an instance of this class with the ContinuousRandomNumber cursor.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG

        public RejectionDistributionBasedPRNG(ContinuousRandomWrapper crw,
                                      RealFunction f,
                                      RealFunction g,
                                      double c,
                                      ContinuousRandomWrapper crwG)
        Constructs a new object of the class.
        Parameters:
        crw - random wrapper delivering random numbers u with u ~ U[0,1]
        f - pdf of the distribution F the produced random numbers should belong to
        g - pdf of the distribution G with f(x) <= c * g(x) f.a. x
        c - the constant c in f(x) <= c * g(x) f.a. x
        crwG - random wrapper delivering random numbers x with x ~ G
        See Also:
        InversionDistributionBasedPRNG, ContinuousRandomWrapper, RealFunction
